newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-JUVENTUS REGAIN SIX-POINT LEAD IN ITALY.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-JUVENTUS REGAIN SIX-POINT LEAD IN ITALY.

text.p: A first-half goal from Croat striker Alen Boksic gave Juventus a precious 1-0 win at Bologna on Saturday and temporarily restored the league leaders' six-point cushion at the top of serie A.
Boksic's 41st minute goal put the European Cup holders on 55 points, ahead of second-placed Parma on 49.
Parma have a tricky home match against Udinese, who beat Juventus 3-0 in Turin last weekend, on Sunday.
The match in Bologna was one of three league fixtures brought forward a day due to European club commitments next week and all three of the Italian hopes won.
Third-placed Inter, who play a UEFA Cup semifinal second leg against Monaco on Tuesday, moved to within one point of Parma after beating Cagliari 2-1 in Sardinia.
Chile's Ivan Zamorano and England midfielder Paul Ince supplied the goals for Inter either side of half time with Cagliari's Sandro Tovalieri pulling one back in the 79th.
Fiorentina, who host Barcelona in a Cup Winners' Cup semifinal second leg on Thursday, beat Roma 2-1 in a mid-table clash thanks to two first-half goals.
